com.example.myapplication.Shared

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.myapplication.Shared.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Intended as a wrapper for the SocketService. Simplifies starting the service, registering callbacks for responses, and sending requests.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean showBuyerUpdate
      Used to enable or disable notifications for new search results.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(android.content.Context context, NetworkResponder loginResponder, java.lang.String loginPayload)
      Starts up the SocketService and attempts to login by creating/updating a user on the server.

      Destroys the SocketService.
      static NetworkManager getInstance()
      Returns the instance of the NetworkManager Singleton

      Sends a request to the server.

      Sends a request to the server.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • showBuyerUpdate

        public boolean showBuyerUpdate
        Used to enable or disable notifications for new search results. In particular, if never set to false, the user would get a notification for new search results even when they are manually executing the request for new search results.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static NetworkManager getInstance()
        Returns the instance of the NetworkManager Singleton
        Returns:
        Returns the instance of the NetworkManager

      • connect

        public void connect(android.content.Context context,
                    NetworkResponder loginResponder,
                    java.lang.String loginPayload)
        Starts up the SocketService and attempts to login by creating/updating a user on the server.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the calling AppCompatActivity.
        loginResponder - The callback upon successful login.
        loginPayload - The user info object used to login.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(android.content.Context context)
        Destroys the SocketService. Must be called to stop the Application's Server listener from running.
        Parameters:
        context - The calling AppCompatActivity.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(java.lang.String topic,
                      NetworkResponder command)
        Adds a callback for a specific topic. Call "unsubscribe" if your callback should not survive destruction of the containing Activity.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to listen and react to.
        command - The callback.

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(java.lang.String topic,
                        NetworkResponder command)
        Unsubscribes a callback for a specific topic. If an Activity instance subscribes to a topic "on the way in", it should also unsubscribe "on the way out". Make sure to keep the original "command" parameter used to subscribe with.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic the original callback was subscribed to.
        command - The original callback used in the call to "subscribe".

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String endPoint,
                 java.lang.String payload)
        Sends a request to the server.
        Parameters:
        endPoint - The endpoint the request should go to.
        payload - The request body, if it exists.

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String endPoint)
        Sends a request to the server. Overload for payload-less requests.
        Parameters:
        endPoint - The endpoint the request should go to.
